definitions: Suggested or hinted at something bad or unpleasant in an indirect and unpleasant way.
Introduced (an idea or feeling) gradually and artfully into someone's mind.
Maneuvered oneself into a position of favor or office by subtle manipulation.
examples: He insinuated that she was lying.
She insinuated herself into the group.
The rumor was insinuated into the conversation.
